'''iOS 17''' is the [[iOS version history|seventeenth and current major release]] of [[Apple Inc.|Apple]]'s [[iOS]] operating system for the [[iPhone]]. It is the direct successor to [[iOS 16]], which was released one year earlier. It was announced on June 5, 2023, at Apple's annual [[Worldwide Developers Conference]] alongside [[watchOS#watchOS 10|watchOS 10]], [[iPadOS 17]], and [[macOS Sonoma]]. It was made publicly available on September 18, 2023 as a free software update for supported iOS devices (see the [[#Supported devices|supported devices]] section).<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.macrumors.com/2023/09/18/apple-releases-ios-17/|title=Apple Releases iOS 17 With StandBy, Live Voicemail, Improved Autocorrect, FaceTime Video Messages and Tons More|website=[[MacRumors]]|first=Juli|last=Clover|date=September 18, 2023|access-date=September 18, 2023}}</ref> iOS 17 receives new security updates multiple times a month, and gets new feature updates every few months (and will continue to get feature updates until the release of iOS 18). Beta builds are sent out on a weekly/biweekly basis for members of [[Apple Developer Program|Apple's Developer Program]] and [[public beta]] testers. As with every release since [[iOS 4]], these updates are available at no additional cost to users. 

Reception for iOS 17 upon release was generally positive,<ref>{{Cite web |last=Cipriani |first=Jason |date=2023-09-25 |title=iOS 17 is full of surprise and delight |url=https://www.cnn.com/cnn-underscored/reviews/ios-17 |access-date=2023-12-12 |website=CNN Underscored |language=en}}</ref><ref name=":6">{{Cite web |title=Apple iOS 17 Review |url=https://www.pcmag.com/reviews/apple-ios-17 |access-date=2023-12-12 |website=PCMAG |language=en}}</ref><ref name=":7">{{Cite web |title=iOS 17 Review: StandBy Mode, Meaningful Changes in Messages and More |url=https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/ios-17-review-standby-mode-meaningful-changes-in-messages-and-more/ |access-date=2023-12-12 |website=CNET |language=en}}</ref> praising the new Contact Posters, Check In, and StandBy mode. Critics also praised the improvements to stickers, widgets, text prediction, the Camera app, Shortcuts, verification codes, and the Reminders app.<ref name=":7" /> However, media outlets criticized the lack of the [[Journal (Apple)|Journal]] app that was announced during the iOS 17 segment in the keynote.<ref name=":6" /><ref name=":7" /> The Journal app was later released, first as part of the iOS 17.2 beta to developers and public beta testers, then to the general public as part of the iOS 17.2 stable release.

== Development ==
According to Mark Gurman, iOS 17's internal codename is Dawn. Apple leaders intended iOS 17 as a "tuneup release", similarly to [[iOS 12]] and [[Mac OS X Snow Leopard]], allowing them to focus on their new [[Apple mixed reality headset|mixed reality headset]]. Despite this, several major features were eventually added later in the development cycle.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Gurman |first=Mark |date=January 8, 2023 |title=Apple Will Talk Up Its Mixed-Reality Headset in 2023 But Not Much Else |language=en |work=Bloomberg News |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/newsletters/2023-01-08/when-will-apple-launch-the-reality-pro-mixed-reality-headset-apple-2023-devices-lcnfzkc7 |access-date=May 31, 2023}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Malik |first=Aisha |date=March 27, 2023 |title=Apple's iOS 17 may include 'several' requested features |url=https://techcrunch.com/2023/03/27/apples-ios-17-may-include-several-requested-features/ |access-date=May 31, 2023 |website=TechCrunch |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |last=Gurman |first=Mark |date=May 24, 2023 |title=Apple Plans to Turn Locked iPhones Into Smart Displays With iOS 17 |language=en |work=Bloomberg News |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2023-05-24/apple-aapl-plans-to-turn-locked-iphones-into-smart-displays-with-ios-17 |access-date=May 31, 2023}}</ref>

== System features ==

=== Home Screen ===
* The widgets are now interactive, on the Home and Lock screens. For example, users can turn on the lights or shutters of the house by pressing the corresponding button of the Home widget; or mark a task complete by pressing directly on a reminder in the widget, etc.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}
* [[Spotlight (Apple)|Spotlight search]] now allows users to change system settings directly from the search results. For example, if the user searches for "wifi" from the Home Screen, the switch to turn the Wi-Fi off or on appears directly in the search results.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}

* Other changes:
** The brightness of the wallpaper image changes depending on the dark or light mode.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}
** Resized photos are automatically extended to the top with a gradient that fills the missing space.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}
** Live wallpapers return after being removed from iOS 16, though they must now be selected separately from other photos and act differently, now only animating when the phone is turned on.<ref>{{Cite web |title=iOS 17 brings back Live Photos as wallpapers on the Lock Screen|url=https://superchargednews.com/2023/06/07/ios-17-live-photos-as-wallpapers/|access-date=2023-11-17|website= Supercharged news|language=en}}</ref> 
** The font weight for the text on the lock screen now has a slider that allows the user to adjust the weight more freely, though the previous options remain intact.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}
** Wallpaper options now include the option to add a wallpaper filled with various emoji of the user's choice and up to 6 can be chosen. 
*** Additionally, there are also new kaleidoscope wallpapers.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}

=== StandBy ===
* StandBy mode is a new feature automatically enabled when the phone is charging while horizontally oriented. It displays information via widgets in intelligent stacks and Live activities also the clock.<ref>{{Cite web |title=iOS 17: Exciting New Features iPhone Users Should Prepare For |url=https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/ios-17-exciting-new-features-iphone-users-should-prepare-for/ |access-date=2023-09-19 |website=CNET |language=en}}</ref> The appearance of this information changes according to the ambient light, so at night they appear with less flashy and less bright colors.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}

=== Autocorrect and text prediction ===

* The keyboard's autocorrection and dictation are powered by a new on-device [[transformer model]], which Apple says is more accurate and personalized to users' writing styles. .{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}

* Unlike previous versions of iOS, it can learn not to autocorrect [[swear words]].<ref>{{Cite news |last=Hassan |first=Jennifer |date=June 6, 2023 |title=Apple says new iPhone autocorrect will know you don't mean 'duck' |newspaper=Washington Post |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2023/06/06/apple-duck-autocorrect-update-ios17/ |access-date=June 17, 2023}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Vigliarolo |first=Brandon |title=Apple fixes 'ducking' autocorrect in iOS 17 |url=https://www.theregister.com/2023/06/07/duck_off_apple_autocorrect/ |access-date=June 17, 2023 |website=The Register |language=en}}</ref> 

* Autocorrected words are underlined, and can be reverted with a tap.

* Word predictions are shown inline as gray letters that are added when the spacebar is tapped.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Rossignol |first=Joe |date=June 5, 2023 |title=iOS 17 Promises to Dramatically Improve iPhone's Autocorrect |url=https://www.macrumors.com/2023/06/05/ios-17-improved-autocorrect/ |access-date=June 17, 2023 |website=MacRumors |language=en}}</ref>  

* As of iOS 17.2, the option to turn off inline predictions without turning off predictive text was added, which allows the user to switch autocorrect to that of its function in prior versions.<ref>{{Cite web |last= Espósito |first=Filipe |date=November 14, 2023 |title=iOS 17.2 lets users disable inline text predictions without turning off predictive text |url= https://9to5mac.com/2023/11/14/ios-17-2-disable-inline-text-predictions/#:~:text=With%20the%20third%20beta%20of,turn%20off%20inline%20text%20predictions. |access-date=November 17, 2023 |website=9to5Mac |language=en}}</ref>

=== AirDrop ===
* With the addition of NameDrop, by tapping an iPhone or Apple Watch against another iPhone, users can start a file transfer, a shared activity with SharePlay, or exchange a customizable contact card.<ref>{{Cite web |first1=Sarah |last1=Perez |first2=Aisha |last2=Malik |date=June 5, 2023 |title=AirDrop in iOS 17 will let you share contact info by bringing two iPhones close together |url=https://techcrunch.com/2023/06/05/airdrop-in-ios-17-will-let-you-share-contact-info-by-bringing-two-iphones-close-together |access-date=June 17, 2023 |website=[[TechCrunch]]}}</ref>  (Using NameDrop with an Apple Watch requires iOS 17.1 and [[watchOS 10|watchOS 10.1]].)

* With iOS 17.1, [[AirDrop]] file transfers can continue over the Internet if users leave AirDrop range.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.macrumors.com/guide/ios-17-1-features/|title=iOS 17.1 Features: What's New in iOS 17.1|first=Juli|last=Clover|date=October 25, 2023|website=[[MacRumors]]}}</ref>

=== Siri ===
* Users can now simply say "Siri" instead of "Hey Siri" to activate it.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web |date=2023-09-15 |title=iOS 17: Everything New With Siri and Spotlight |url=https://www.macrumors.com/guide/ios-17-siri-spotlight/ |access-date=2023-12-06 |website=MacRumors |language=en}}</ref>

* Subsequent questions asked to Siri do not require the user to re-say the "Siri" command.<ref name=":1" />

* The user can now say "Hey Siri, send a message" and then choose the application to use through a drop-down menu.<ref name=":1" /> After the first change, Siri will remember the choice and speed up the operation. 

* Users can ask Siri to read a page in [[Safari (web browser)|Safari]].{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}

* Additionally, the ability to find a lost [[Siri Remote|Apple TV remote]] with it with was added.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}

=== Enhanced AutoFill ===
* The information saved by the user in Contacts can be used to automatically and securely fill in the fields of a form of a PDF or scanned document. Scanning documents take place in Notes.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Dsouza |first=Darryl |date=2023-06-12 |title=How to Use Enhanced AutoFill and Collaborate on PDF Files on iPhone, iPad and Mac |url=https://www.macobserver.com/tips/how-to/use-enhanced-autofill-and-collaborate-on-pdf-files-on-iphone-ipad-and-mac/ |access-date=2023-12-06 |website=The Mac Observer |language=en-US}}</ref>

=== Accessibility ===

* A new feature called ''Personal Voice'' uses machine learning to let users recreate their own voice as a text-to-speech model.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Velazco |first=Chris |date=May 16, 2023 |title=Apple will let you teach your iPhone to speak in your voice |newspaper=Washington Post |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2023/05/16/apple-personal-voice-ai-iphone/ |access-date=June 17, 2023}}</ref>  

* Using ''Point and speak'', the phone will read what is written on the push-button panels of household appliances. 

* ''Assistive Access'' is an extremely simplified iOS user interface that can be activated from the Accessibility settings, useful for people with cognitive disabilities.

=== Networking ===

* A user can now connect an iPhone to a private [[5G]] or [[LTE (telecommunication)|LTE]] cellular network, using an [[eSIM]] or physical SIM that has been specifically provisioned for that network.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Apple device support for private 5G and LTE networks |url=https://support.apple.com/guide/deployment/support-for-private-5g-and-lte-networks-depac6747317/web |access-date=2023-08-12 |website=Apple Support |language=en}}</ref> 
* There is also a new setting for cellular networks allows users to disable cellular data usage statistics if they do not care which apps are consuming data.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}

=== System settings ===
* In addition to an updated UI that shows more categories, the iPhone Storage section of the settings app now shows the space occupied by data shared between multiple apps from the same manufacturer.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}

* In the Haptic Touch duration settings, there is a third duration that is even shorter than the other two available in iOS 16.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-08-30 |title=iOS 17: How to Make Haptic Touch Faster on iPhone |url=https://www.macrumors.com/how-to/make-haptic-touch-faster-on-iphone/ |access-date=2023-12-06 |website=MacRumors |language=en}}</ref>

* A new option for [[IOS 15#Focus|Focus]] mode notifications was added called ''Silence Notifications''. This options lets the user choose if they want to mute notifications always or only when the device is locked.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}

* In iOS 17, the notification sound was changed from "Tri-tone", to "Rebound", which is noticeably quieter. As of iOS 17.2, the ability to change the default sound effect for third party apps was added, including the previously default "Tri-tone" option.<ref>{{Cite web |last= Hendrickson |first= Josh |date=November 30, 2023 |title=Apple's Latest iOS Beta Finally Lets You Change the Default Notification Sound |url= https://www.pcmag.com/news/apples-latest-ios-beta-finally-lets-you-change-the-default-notification |access-date=December 2, 2023 |website=PCmag |language=en}}</ref>

=== Charging ===
* iPhone 15 models now support [[Qi (standard)|Qi2]] wireless charging. This was later added to the [[iPhone 13]] and [[iPhone 14]] models in iOS 17.2.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Peters |first=Jay |date=2023-12-05 |title=iPhone 13 and iPhone 14 will get Qi2 support with iOS 17.2 |url=https://www.theverge.com/2023/12/5/23989606/iphone-13-14-qi2-magsafe-compatible-apple-ios-17-2 |access-date=2023-12-06 |website=The Verge |language=en}}</ref>

== App features ==

=== Phone ===
With Contact Posters, users can now customize the appearance of the incoming call screen shown to other iPhone users.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-06-14 |title=How to make a Contact Poster in iOS 17 with an iPhone |url=https://appleinsider.com/inside/ios-17/tips/how-to-make-a-contact-poster-in-ios-17-with-an-iphone |access-date=2023-08-08 |website=AppleInsider |language=en}}</ref> Customization options are similar to [[IOS 16#Lock screen|iOS 16's revamped lock screen]], with the ability to pick a custom picture or [[Memoji]] as the contact photo, and change their name's font and color. On the incoming call screen, a new Live Voicemail button sends the call to voicemail and shows a live transcript on-screen, so the user can decide whether to pick up the call.<ref name="TheVergeannounces" /><ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-06-23 |title=How to view transcriptions of calls with Live Voicemail in iOS 17 |url=https://appleinsider.com/inside/ios-17/tips/how-to-use-live-voicemail-in-ios-17 |access-date=2023-08-08 |website=AppleInsider |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=How to use iOS 17's 'Live Voicemail' transcriptions, and which iPhones support it |url=https://www.zdnet.com/article/how-to-use-ios-17s-live-voicemail-transcriptions-and-which-iphones-support-it/ |access-date=2023-12-12 |website=ZDNET |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Apple's iOS 17 Live Voicemails Bring Back a Feature of Old-School Tech |url=https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/apples-ios-17-live-voicemails-bring-back-a-feature-of-old-school-tech/ |access-date=2023-12-12 |website=CNET |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Apple's iOS 17 is changing the way you check your voicemail. Here's how it works. |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/problemsolved/2023/09/19/apple-ios-17-update-live-voicemail/70864985007/ |access-date=2023-12-12 |website=USA TODAY |language=en-US}}</ref>

Other improvements:<ref name=":2">{{Cite web |date=2023-09-15 |title=iOS 17: What's New With Phone and FaceTime |url=https://www.macrumors.com/guide/ios-17-phone-facetime-features/ |access-date=2023-12-06 |website=MacRumors |language=en}}</ref>

* Different ringtones for each SIM.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}
* Increased the number of calls in call history to 2000.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}
* Users can choose which SIM to use to call all unknown numbers.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}
* The buttons to end a phone call, mute the microphone, etc. are positioned at the bottom instead of being in the center of the screen, so they are more accessible when using the phone with only one hand.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}
* Added more than 20 new ringtones and 11 alert tones.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Peters |first=Jay |date=2023-09-12 |title=The iPhone is getting new ringtones |url=https://www.theverge.com/2023/9/12/23870868/apple-iphone-ios-17-new-ringtones |access-date=2023-12-06 |website=The Verge |language=en}}</ref>

=== Messages ===
The [[Messages (Apple)|Messages app]] has a new "Check In" feature. The user picks a contact and sets a destination, and Check In notifies the contact once the user reaches the destination safely. If the user stops moving towards the destination and does not respond to prompts, the user's location, route, and battery level are automatically shared with the contact. The contact otherwise has no access to the user's location, and this information is [[end-to-end encrypted]].<ref>{{Cite web |last=Grothaus |first=Michael |date=June 5, 2023 |title=Exclusive: Apple software chief Craig Federighi on iOS 17's new privacy features, why he's afraid of AI, and why he's not |url=https://www.fastcompany.com/90904197/apple-ios-17-craig-federighi-privacy-check-in-lockdown-mode-safari |access-date=June 17, 2023 |website=Fast Company}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Moussie |first=Stéphane |date=June 9, 2023 |title=iOS 17 : comment faire savoir à vos amis que vous êtes bien rentré grâce à Check In |url=https://www.igen.fr/ios/2023/06/ios-17-comment-faire-savoir-vos-amis-que-vous-etes-bien-rentre-grace-check-137709 |access-date=June 17, 2023 |website=iGeneration |language=fr}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Coldewey |first=Devin |date=June 5, 2023 |title=How to tell friends you got home safe with iPhone's new Check In feature |url=https://techcrunch.com/2023/06/05/how-to-get-use-ios-iphones-new-check-in-feature-imessage/ |access-date=June 17, 2023 |website=TechCrunch}}</ref> 

Other improvements:

* The Messages app also shows a transcript of voice messages.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}
* Emojis and photo cutouts (created through the "remove subject from background" tool) can be used as stickers, and stamped on bubbles in iMessage conversations or in other apps.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Clover |first=Juli |date=June 6, 2023 |title=You Can Turn Your Photos Into Animated Stickers With iOS 17 |url=https://www.macrumors.com/2023/06/06/ios-17-animated-stickers/ |access-date=June 17, 2023 |website=MacRumors |language=en}}</ref>
* in iOS 17.2, a new feature called contact key verification was added. This adds an extra layer of security to iMessages, as these keys are exchanged by users when they meet up in person or can be automatically shared with FaceTime, and if at any point a device not registered with they key sends a message, the other user will be notified.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web |last=Potuck |first=Michael |date=2023-10-27 |title=Turn on Contact Key Verification iMessage on iPhone |url=https://9to5mac.com/2023/10/27/turn-on-contact-key-verification-imessage-iphone/ |access-date=2023-12-06 |website=9to5Mac |language=en-US}}</ref>

=== Journal ===
* Journal is a [[End-to-end encryption|end-to-end encrypted]] [[Diary|journaling]] app that lets users log their daily activities. The app was not available at launch and was added in the iOS 17.2 update. <ref>{{Cite web |last=Davis |first=Wes |date=2023-12-11 |title=iOS 17.2 arrives with new Journal app and spatial video capture support |url=https://www.theverge.com/2023/12/11/23990347/ios-17-2-released-iphone-update-journal-app-spatial-video |access-date=2023-12-12 |website=The Verge |language=en}}</ref>

=== Apple Music ===
* A new feture called "Collaborative Playlist allows a group of users to add and remove songs from a shared playlist.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}} (this was removed in iOS 17.2 Beta 4, but later re-added in 17.3 beta 1{{citation needed|date=December 2023}})
* [[Fade (audio engineering)#Crossfading|Crossfade]] effect between played songs, supporting a range between 1 second and 12 seconds.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-09-21 |title=How and why to crossfade Apple Music tracks in iOS 17 |url=https://appleinsider.com/inside/apple-music/tips/how-to-crossfade-apple-music-tracks-in-ios-17 |access-date=2023-12-06 |website=AppleInsider |language=en}}</ref>
* ''Animated album artwork in music player'': albums that support animated album artwork will now show the animation in the music player on Apple Music.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}
* In iOS 17.1,  the "Love" system in Apple Music was repaced by a "Favorites" section that comes with expanded functionality.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-09-27 |title=Everything New in iOS 17.1 Beta 1 |url=https://www.macrumors.com/2023/09/27/ios-17-1-beta-1-features/ |access-date=2023-09-28 |website=MacRumors |language=en}}</ref>
* In iOS 17.2, Apple brought a Favorite Songs Playlist<ref name=":3">{{Cite web |title=iOS 17.2 RC is out now with Journal app and lots of new features and changes |url=https://www.macworld.com/article/2117707/ios-17-2-beta-is-out-now-and-includes-the-journal-app.html |access-date=2023-12-06 |website=Macworld |language=en}}</ref>
* With iOS 17.2, users can now disable Listening History in a focus mode<ref name=":3" />

=== Maps ===
* ''Offline maps'': maps can now be downloaded for use without an Internet connection.<ref>{{Cite web |author1=Axel Metz |date=2023-10-30 |title=How to download Apple Maps for offline use in iOS 17 |url=https://www.techradar.com/phones/ios/how-to-download-apple-maps-for-offline-use-in-ios-17 |access-date=2023-12-06 |website=TechRadar |language=en}}</ref>
* ''Charging stations for electric vehicles'': it is possible to see in real time the availability of charging points for electric vehicles, in particular how many free slots there are at that particular charging point, the type of connection, etc.<ref>{{Cite web |first=Chance |last=Miller |date=August 19, 2023 |title=iOS 17 adds real-time charging availability info for EV drivers |url=https://9to5mac.com/2023/08/19/ios-17-adds-real-time-charging-availability-info-for-ev-drivers/ |access-date=December 6, 2023 |website=9to5Mac}}</ref>
* ''Search for people by name'': users can search people on the map by name if they have shared their location.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-09-15 |title=iOS 17 Maps Features |url=https://www.macrumors.com/guide/ios-17-maps/ |access-date=2023-12-06 |website=MacRumors |language=en}}</ref>

=== Safari ===
* ''Profiles'': Safari supports Profiles to keep a user's browsing activities separate when they are at work or school from those at home or personal. Individual Safari extensions can be enabled or disabled by profile.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Use profiles in Safari on Mac |url=https://support.apple.com/en-us/105100 |access-date=2023-12-06 |website=Apple Support |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=updated |first=Richard Priday last |date=2023-07-17 |title=Safari profiles in iOS 17 are a game-changer — here's how to set them up |url=https://www.tomsguide.com/how-to/how-to-set-up-safari-profiles-on-iphone |access-date=2023-12-06 |website=Tom's Guide |language=en}}</ref>
* ''Private browsing protected by Face ID:'' the pages previously opened in Private browsing mode require Face ID to be reviewed.<ref name=":4">{{Cite web |date=2023-09-21 |title=Safari's Private Browsing Mode Just Made Your Private Tabs Way More Private on iOS 17 |url=https://ios.gadgethacks.com/how-to/safaris-private-browsing-mode-just-made-your-private-tabs-way-more-private-ios-17-0385430/ |access-date=2023-12-06 |website=Gadget Hacks |language=en}}</ref>
* ''Private browsing extensions'': Any extension that can read info on a page the user visits is disabled by default when private browsing.<ref name=":4" />
* Tracking private browsing: Known tackers are blocked while private browsing and tracking IDs in links are automatically removed.<ref name=":4" />
* ''Private search engine'': in the Safari settings, users can set a separate search engine to use in private mode.<ref name=":4" />
* ''Listen to Page'' allows users to listen to the entire page as audio read from the phone.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-06-18 |title=iOS 17: How To Listen to A Page on iPhone and What Is It |url=https://nerdschalk.com/listen-to-page-iphone/ |access-date=2023-12-06 |website=Nerds Chalk |language=en-US}}</ref>
* The browsing history now shows favicons next to the site name and description.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}
* Added support for JPEG XL and HEIC image formats.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}
* [[AV1]] hardware decoding on [[iPhone 15 Pro]] and [[iPhone 15 Pro Max]]<ref name="safari17">{{Cite web |last=Simmons |first=Jen |date=2023-09-18 |title=WebKit Features in Safari 17.0 |url=https://webkit.org/blog/14445/webkit-features-in-safari-17-0/ |access-date=2023-09-19 |website=WebKit |quote=Safari 17.0 adds support for AV1 video on devices with hardware decoding support, like iPhone 15 Pro and iPhone 15 Pro Max.}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-09-15 |title=iOS 17 Safari Features: Profiles, Locked Private Browser, Shared Passwords, Updated Tracking Prevention and More |url=https://www.macrumors.com/guide/ios-17-safari/ |access-date=2023-12-06 |website=MacRumors |language=en}}</ref>

=== Notes ===
* Users can create links between notes to quickly jump from one note to another.<ref name=":5">{{Cite web |date=2023-09-15 |title=iOS 17 Notes and Reminders Features |url=https://www.macrumors.com/guide/ios-17-notes-reminders/ |access-date=2023-12-06 |website=MacRumors |language=en}}</ref>
* Users can view and annotate PDFs directly within the app.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}

=== Reminders ===

* The list of a reminder can now be organized into sections.<ref name=":5" />
* The Grocery list now  automatically sorts grocery items into sections.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}
* There is a new column view.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}

=== Photos ===
* ''Recipe search'': users can search for recipes on the Internet using a photo containing food.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-09-15 |title=iOS 17 Photos Features: Pet Recognition, Recipe Identification, One-Tap Crop and More |url=https://www.macrumors.com/guide/ios-17-photos-and-camera/ |access-date=2023-12-06 |website=MacRumors |language=en}}</ref>
* ''Pet recognition'': dogs and cats are automatically recognized and categorized within the people section.<ref>{{Cite web |title=iOS 17: Your Updated Photos App Can Recognize Your Pets Now |url=https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/ios-17-your-updated-photos-app-recognizes-your-pets-now/ |access-date=2023-12-06 |website=CNET |language=en}}</ref>
* ''Simplified cropping'': when a user zooms in on a photo, a button automatically appears to crop the photo without having to go into photo editing first.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}
* ''Search for objects in videos'': in the search box, users can type the name of an object to find the exact frame in the video where that object appears.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}
*Visual Lookup is now able to recognize in photos the symbols of the various lights in the car, the symbols in the labels of clothes, etc.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}

=== Camera ===
* The Camera app has two new optional settings: "Level" shows a horizontal line that turns yellow when the subject is aligned to the horizon, and "Lock white balance" can disable automatic white balance adjustments when recording a video.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-09-28 |title=There Are 18 New Features Hiding in Your iPhone's Camera App on iOS 17 |url=https://ios.gadgethacks.com/how-to/there-are-18-new-features-hiding-your-iphones-camera-app-ios-17-0385438/ |access-date=2023-12-06 |website=Gadget Hacks |language=en}}</ref>

* ''Deferred Photo Processing'': the ''Deep Fusion'' post-processing process is performed in the background, instead of taking place at the same time as the "shot" and only when the camera is not in use. This ensures significantly higher recording sessions, without shutter blocks, allowing the user to capture new photos at any time.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Create a more responsive camera experience - WWDC23 - Videos |url=https://developer.apple.com/videos/play/wwdc2023/10105/ |access-date=2023-08-12 |website=Apple Developer |language=en}}</ref>

=== Weather ===
* A wind map has been added.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}
* The Weather app now lets users compare today's weather with yesterday's. <ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-08-14 |title=Here's What's New in the iOS 17 Weather App |url=https://www.macrumors.com/guide/ios-17-weather-app/ |access-date=2023-12-06 |website=MacRumors |language=en}}</ref>
* ''Moon phase'': a new section shows the current state of the moon, the time until the next full moon, the times of moonset and moonrise and the lunar calendar.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}

=== Health ===
* The [[Health (Apple)|Health app]] lets users log and label their mood, and see how their mood correlates to various lifestyle factors over time.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Clover |first=Juli |date=June 5, 2023 |title=You Can Log Your Moods and Emotions in iOS 17 |url=https://www.macrumors.com/2023/06/05/ios-17-mood-logging/ |access-date=June 17, 2023 |website=MacRumors |language=en}}</ref> The app also let users take standardized assessments for anxiety and depression, although this information is not diagnosis and should not be treated as such.<ref name="health-insights-apple-press-release">{{cite press release |url=https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2023/06/apple-provides-powerful-insights-into-new-areas-of-health/ |title=Apple provides powerful insights into new areas of health |publisher=Apple |access-date=June 17, 2023}}</ref>
* Users can be notified if they forget to log that they have taken their medication.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}
* Added summary of users' friends' training results.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}

=== Shortcuts ===
* Commands associated with various apps are shown in Spotlight search when users search for that app. For example, when searching for the Camera app, commands to open the app in Selfie, Portrait, Cinematic, Time-Lapse, etc. modes are shown.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}
* Developers can define the background color of commands created for their app. For example, for the Books app, the commands to open the current book and listen to the current book appear in an orange box like the color of the Books app.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}

=== Miscellaneous ===
*The Home app now includes an activity history for up to 30 days, so the user can see who's accessed the user's locks, doors and alarm sensors, and when.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Sandy |date=2023-10-12 |title=How to view Home app's Activity History in iOS 17, iPadOS 17, and macOS Sonoma |url=https://www.igeeksblog.com/how-to-view-home-apps-activity-history-on-iphone-ipad-mac/ |access-date=2023-12-06 |website=iGeeksBlog |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Close |first=Christopher |date=2023-09-11 |title=How to View Your Smart Home Activity History in the Apple Home App |url=https://www.makeuseof.com/how-to-view-home-activity-history-apple-home-app/ |access-date=2023-12-06 |website=MUO |language=en}}</ref>
*[[Apple Fitness+]] can give users custom workout plans, set workouts or meditations to play consecutively, or separately change the volume of the music and the instructor's voice.<ref name="health-insights-apple-press-release" />
*''A new feature called screen Distance'' checks and warns users if they are holding their Face-ID enabled iPhone too close to the user's face for a considerable period of time.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Schroeder |first=Stan |date=2023-06-17 |title=How to enable Screen Distance in iOS 17 to protect your kid's eyes |url=https://mashable.com/article/how-to-enable-screen-distance-ios-17 |access-date=2023-12-06 |website=Mashable |language=en}}</ref>
*The Clock app now supports multiple simultaneous timers.<ref>{{Cite web |last=updated |first=John-Anthony Disotto last |date=2023-06-14 |title=How to use multiple timers at once on iOS 17 |url=https://www.imore.com/ios/ios-17/how-to-use-multiple-timers-at-once-on-ios-17 |access-date=2023-12-06 |website=iMore |language=en}}</ref>
*Find My now supports sharing [[AirTag]]s and similar third-party items with up to five people.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Mughal |first=Naveed |date=2023-09-30 |title=How to share an AirTag with others in iOS 17 {{!}} TheOrcTech |url=https://medium.com/@naveedmughal063063/how-to-share-an-airtag-with-others-in-ios-17-theorctech-fe80d31fea42 |access-date=2023-12-06 |website=Medium |language=en}}</ref>
*FaceTime supports the ability for callers to leave a video or audio message when the recipient is unavailable. Effect reactions have been added to FaceTime calls, similar to the reactions feature in Messages.<ref name=":2" />

== Security and privacy ==

* One-time verification codes received in Mail can be filled in with a tap without leaving Safari.<ref>{{Cite web |title=You Can Now Autofill Email Verification Codes on iOS 17 |url=https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/you-can-now-autofill-email-verification-codes-on-ios-17/ |access-date=2023-12-06 |website=CNET |language=en}}</ref> 
* Additionally, The ability to automatically delete verification codes was added.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Jain |first1=Krati |title=The latest iteration of iOS, iOS 17, introduces a range of fresh security and privacy enhancements |url=https://worldwidebriefs.com/the-latest-iteration-of-ios-ios-17-introduces-a-range-of-fresh-security-and-privacy-enhancements/ |website=World Wide News Briefs}}</ref>

* Link-tracking protection detects user-definable tracking parameters in link URLs and automatically removes them. It is automatically enabled in Mail, Messages, and when browsing with Safari in Private Mode.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}

* Shared group passwords allows the user to create groups of passwords to share with family and friends.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-09-27 |title=How to easily share passwords in iOS 17 |url=https://www.asurion.com/connect/tech-tips/how-to-share-passwords-in-ios-17/ |access-date=2023-12-06 |website=Asurion |language=en-us}}</ref> Users can recover passwords for up to 30 days. {{citation needed|date=December 2023}}

* After changing the lock screen passcode, the old code can be used for 72 hours to reset the new passcode if it is forgotten.<ref>{{Cite web |last=updated |first=Richard Priday last |date=2023-06-16 |title=Whoops! iOS 17 has a great new feature if you forget your passcode |url=https://www.tomsguide.com/news/ios-17-has-a-great-new-feature-if-you-forget-your-passcode |access-date=2023-12-06 |website=Tom's Guide |language=en}}</ref> There's also a button to expire previous passcode immediately.

* iOS 17 contains several changes for app permissions. When an app wants to add an event to the user's Calendar, the event is added without the app being able to read the entire contents of the calendar. When apps ask to access the user's entire photo library, the user can share specific photos with apps while keeping the rest of the library private.

* A sensitive content warning detects nudity in photos and videos received in AirDrop and other apps, obscuring them with a blur effect before they are displayed.

* Lockdown mode can block the iPhone from connecting to 2G cellular networks and from auto-joining insecure wireless networks, and it disables more APIs in Safari susceptible to being attacked, such as IndexedDB, File API, FileReader API, WebSpeech API, WebLocks API, and more.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Safari 17 Beta Release Notes |url=https://docs.developer.apple.com/documentation/safari-release-notes/safari-17-release-notes |access-date=June 11, 2023 |website=Apple Developer Documentation |language=en-US}}</ref>
Apple's simultaneously-announced watchOS 10 gains support for Lockdown mode, and the mode is automatically enabled on Apple Watch when it is enabled on a paired iPhone.

== Supported devices ==
iOS 17 requires an [[Apple A12|A12 Bionic]] SoC or later. It drops support for iPhones with [[Apple A11|A11 Bionic]]{{efn|[[iPhone 8]], 8 Plus and [[iPhone X|X]]}} chips, officially marking the end of support for 5.5-inch iPhones. iOS 17 is also the first iOS version to drop support for an iPhone with Face ID and no "Home" button.

Those using either A12 Bionic{{Efn|[[iPhone XS]], XS Max, and [[iPhone XR|XR]]}} or [[Apple A13|A13 Bionic]]{{Efn|[[iPhone 11]], [[iPhone 11 Pro|11 Pro]], 11 Pro Max, and [[iPhone SE (2nd generation)|the second-generation SE]]}} have limited support{{Efn|Effect reactions, inline word prediction and completion with the tap of the spacebar, and ''Point and speak'' will not be available on devices older than the iPhone 12 series.}} while those using [[Apple A14|A14 Bionic]] and later{{Efn|Fourteenth-generation iPhones ([[iPhone 12]], 12 Mini, [[iPhone 12 Pro|12 Pro]], and 12 Pro Max) and newer}} are fully supported.<ref name="preview">{{Cite web |title=iOS 17 Preview |url=https://www.apple.com/ios/ios-17-preview/ |access-date=June 5, 2023 |website=Apple |language=en-US}}</ref>

Devices that support iOS 17 are as follows.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Here's every iPhone model that will get Apple's iOS 17 |url=https://www.zdnet.com/article/heres-every-iphone-that-will-get-ios-17/ |access-date=2023-12-06 |website=ZDNET |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Espósito |first=Filipe |date=2023-09-19 |title=These are the iPhone models compatible with iOS 17 |url=https://9to5mac.com/2023/09/18/ios-17-compatible-iphone/ |access-date=2023-12-06 |website=9to5Mac |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=No iOS 17 Update on Your iPhone?
